articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz ordered the army on Thursday to prepare a plan to allow the "voluntary departure" of residents from the Gaza strip, Israeli media reported.
articles.title: Israel's defense minister orders army to prepare for Gaza residents' departure, media reports

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: The increase in accuracy to within 50-100m of the intended target suggests North Korea is successfully using the battlefield to test its missile technology, senior Ukrainian sources said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Ukraine sees marked improvement in accuracy of Russia's North Korean missiles

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: The plan for reform at the World Health Organization includes putting an American in charge in order for the United States to remain a member of the global health agency.
articles.title: Trump team considers demanding WHO reform, including American in charge

articles.author: Edward Mcallister, Fatos Bytyci
articles.description: For decades, the Lumbardhi cinema in Kosovo - Europe's newest country - has given locals in the city of Prizren a window on the outside world. It has screened movies from Japan, China and the United States and hosted international artists for its annual documentary film festival.
articles.title: Kosovo feels the pain of EU sanctions as election looms

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday there was nothing wrong in Donald Trump's idea of displacing Palestinians from Gaza after the U.S. president's proposal drew international criticism.
articles.title: Netanyahu praises Trump plan to move Palestinians out of Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nearly 90% of Germans believe foreign actors, primarily from Russia and the U.S., are trying to influence upcoming national elections through social media, a survey found on Thursday.
articles.title: Nearly 90% of Germans fear foreign election interference, finds survey

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, Jack Kim
articles.description: South Korea's impeached prime minister told parliament on Thursday that "everyone" in a hastily-arranged meeting of ministers expressed concerns about President Yoon Suk Yeol's martial law plan before he announced it on Dec. 3.
articles.title: South Korea's impeached prime minister says cabinet expressed concerns over martial law plan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The French Senate approved on Thursday the 2025 budget, sending it to the constitutional council to review.
articles.title: French Senate approves 2025 budget

articles.author: Johan Ahlander
articles.description: Swedish police found several rifles in the adult education centre in Orebro where a gunman killed 11 people and wounded several others this week in the country's deadliest mass shooting, a spokesperson said on Thursday.
articles.title: Swedish police confirm several licensed rifles found at scene of mass shooting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's President Xi Jinping met Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra in Beijing on Thursday, the official Xinhua news agency reported, as the two countries eye closer ties amid growing global uncertainties.
articles.title: China's Xi meets Thai prime minister with trade, online scams in focus
